intro: Tofieldia fusca f. rishiriensis, commonly known as the Rishiri lily, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively on the island of Rishiri in Japan. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and striking, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories or along stream edges.
